content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

You can define the function as follows:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        
        current_line *= (isempty(current_line) ? "" : " ") * word
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

This function splits the input string into words and then iteratively checks whether adding a new word would exceed the maximum text width. If it would, the current line is saved to the list of lines and a new empty line is started. Once all words have been processed, any remaining non-empty line is also saved. The wrapped string is then returned as a single string with newline characters between each line.

Here's an example:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
wrapped_s = wrap_string(s)
println(wrapped_s)
```

This would print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
```
